title: Hilton City München
text: Situated a 10 min walk from medieval wall and 50m walk to metro service means it’s a great location from which to explore wonderful München. 3 adults in room was a squeeze but manageable. Much to recommend it as facilities and room were spotless.

title: Great bier Keller that retains
text: Great bier Keller that retains its Germanic vibe. As it’s a massive place, you just walk in and share any table. Food is very good for a canteen!. If there’s a queue we’ll just wait as the experience is worth it. My goulash was great and the Apple Strudel the very best we’ve had. Go for it.

title: Contrasting Indian experience
text: This Indian restaurant is centrally located in a well-off corner of Essex. Its slightly shabby decor could do with a facelift but should not detract potential customers. Its food is of the highest order and is recommended. In fact, I think it beats Shenfield Tandoori, my usual trusted restaurant. What pulls this place down is the awful customer service: the waiters just did not care. The wine (2 bottles) order was wrong -they opened red instead of white (doh!) and main courses came up haphazardly leaving one of our party of 4 waiting. The food dishes were just dumped on the table without any effort to place according to order. What a shame because the cooking was excellent. The poor service meant that us meek/mild/middle class customers did not pay the usual gratuity. Will they learn: probably not. Will I go back - yes for the food but will be under no illusions that my custom is welcome.

title: Athens first time
text:
Little Kook was really cleverly decorated and worth a visit. It’s a kids place for adults. So far so good. Problems start if you just rock up looking for a table.The waitress was a witch, really . She couldn’t have been more unhelpful if she tried. Unless your party Number matches exactly the available tables/seats then you’re not getting in. Instead they will put you outside on a table on the kerbside, which is not what you want.
Go if you want but don’t make it a “must see” as the welcome can be gruesome/ghastly

title: First time
text: Plenty of parking within 10 mins of this High St restaurant. Excellent Thai food well presented and thoughtfully served. Range of beers and wine to suit easy going palates. So, what’s not to like? Price. At £35 pp for two courses plus two drinks and applied tip it was OTT. A similar curry meal in Brentwood is roughly half this price. Will I go back -certainly but not soon.

title: Acropolis -a world wonder
text: It’s a wonder if the ancient world and is a “must see”. It’s not tourist friendly so need to be a bit agile and sure footed. If it rains, I reckon it could be a hazardous/slippery walk, so wear shoes with good grip/tread The route around the antiquities takes about 2hrs as there is a lot to see/read. We bought audio tours downloaded into iPhones, which were helpful but are not indispensable. We went early and nearly avoided the waves of cruise ship passengers who flooded the site!

title: Pleasant surprise!
text:
Almost all reviews are negative on food and waiting but prsisw the views. The views are truly spectacular and well worth €7.5 each to take funicular railway up to top.30 minute timetable needs to be factored into planning.
We were prepared to haggle for a seat by restaurant window and agreed to walk away if we did not succeed. Eventually the taciturn waiter mellowed and we rearranged tables to achieve a mutually satisfactory outcome! It was a pity that we had to push them, when they could have offered a solution.
The food was 4/5 and better than previous reviews suggested.
Overall this place is worth the visit for the views alone. Prepare to haggle if you cannot pre book an edge seat (recommend early booking). Get there 30 mins before sunset and allow€60 pp for two courses and 2 drinks.

title: English elegance
text: What a wonderful House. It surpasses hotels because Cliveden gathers you into an extended family. From the impeccable housekeeping to the extensive Parterre and NT woodlands, it provides a tranquil environment that drains away stress. We very much appreciated the comfort, homeliness and extensive facilities that our double aspect suite provided us. Dinner was to the high standard expected after pre-prandial aperitifs in the dark but fascinating main hall. Will we come again? Undoubtedly.

title: Ryanair challenge
text:
Bought tickets as it was lowest price for 4 adults even including paying £40/suitcase. No problem with flight but difficulty in adding a last minute bag. It was not me being thick but website not explaining that the service was oversubscribed so no extra bags could be bought.
If I go Ryanair again, I will be better informed about what to expect.
Value for money is what I bought.

title: Must see day & night
text: A stunning display of architecture, tranquil surroundings and well worth a visit (free). We went back at night time to see the whole area lit up beautifully.

title: Alcazar & Cathedral skip-the-line tickets
text: Breathtaking views, a ton of culture and must not be missed. Go for skip-the-line tickets even though cost is high as you do not want to be queuing for ages in the intense sun.
place: Seville Cathedral and Royal Alcazar Skip-the-Line Tickets

title: Ski trip
text: The “go to place” when you finish skiing for the day. Great place for aprės ski, great vibe, lovely people but it does get crowded meaning g it can take ages to get s drink.

title: Austrian commuter
text:
Reliable airline who provide good quality and comfortable ride with sufficient leg room in Economy for a 1.82m passenger. As journey only lasts just over 2 hours, I would be happy for airline to stop serving snacks and just ensure we get a couple of glasses of water on journey.
Cost is comparable to other carriers for this journey.
I continue to use them as they remain reliable.
It would be great if they supplied free WiFi and power points at seat.

title: Dance
text:
Good quality 2* hotel a short walk from park area. Extensive buffet breakfast provides sufficient quality fuel to tackle all the rides! Make the most of it because park food and drink are eye-wateringly expensive.
Spacious room to accommodate 3: good shower and kept clean by busy staff. Excellent reception made checkin and out very simple for a party of 50.
The hotel is expensive but provides reasonable accommodation for Disney.

title: summertime at the Boatyard
text: This place has the wow factor. It's a great location on the estuary with great sea views. The boat layout is subtly done and works. The staff are extremely attentive and made our visit memorable. However, this is a restaurant and its primary objective is surely to deliver food to enjoy and make you want to come back. 1 out of 5 unfortunately. Starter was plain and boring: San Danielle ham on limp lettuce followed by Chicken Caesar Salad with lack lustre Iceberg and not Romaine lettuce. The chicken was overcooked too. What a shame! We will try once more as I am sure it deserves another chance. Fingers crossed.

title: Boat tripper's reviw
text: 4 of us visited on a Wednesday evening; pub packed watching footie. Really helpful bar staff sorted out seats for us and a table. Splendid food and well kept beer make this a cracking pub and one to which we would return at any opportunity.

title: Boat trippers
text: Really well kept flight of locks with helpful and industrious volunteer helpers in a lovely country setting. well worth the effort!

title: Best restaurant for miles around
text:
I visit Macedonia 4 times a year and been to this restaurant many, many times because it is so good. Traditional food in traditional setting and great for people watching as the customers ebb and flow during the evening.
I do not care much for the loud music and garish TV screens also detract but these small points can be overlooked. I do wish they would serve točeno pivo instead of bottled beer.
If you are in the area then go here.
placeLocation: Sveti Nikole, Republic of North Macedonia

title: Rochdale Canal exploration
text: Firmly managed by owner Susan, this company provided an excellent canal boat for a Fathers & sons cruise on this splendid canal. We have been canal boating for many years and this boat was by far the best quality. We did suffer a mechanical failure (failed alternator) but Shire's immediate response was excellent and we were underway very quickly. Our cruise to Summit Lock through panoramic countryside was made easier by Susan's skillful and detailed advice before we set off. There are locks every 15 mins (well almost) so you need a minimum 4-man team (yes "man" as some lock gates are very big & heavy). This is a strenuous "cruise" but well worth the effort for the countryside and local pubs.

title: 007 xperience
text: Opulent,old world charm from this spectacular hotel steeped in 007 James Bond history. Unbelievably, the current Head Concierge, Jose, is still at the hotel and had a part in Lazenby's Bond film. From the silver service and white gloved waiting staff to the large and quiet swimming pool this hotel ranks as one of my all time favourites. It is not cheap but well worth the price. No co mplaints!
place: Palacio Estoril Hotel, Golf and Spa

title: 4 day getaway
text:
A great choice for us: enough charm in the building allied to good customer care and lovely aspect from extensive garden.
Restaurant service was slow but countered by well cooked meals included in our reasonably priced DB&B deal.
Overall an enjoyable stay

title: Lakes Country Hotel
text: DB&B for 4 nights was not cheap but the suite was capacious and up to a good standard. The main house was splendid all 2800's charm. The hotel dinners are the best I have tasted outside of top class restaurants (I was very pleasantly surprised). I would have no hesitation in recommending a splendid hotel

title: Lunch with good friends
text: We have been here before and never been disappointed. Welcoming staff serving good quality food in comfortable, stylish surroundings

title: Family celebration -Mother's day
text: We were well looked after by attentive staff in gastro pub environment. good food at sensible prices.

title: one night stay...was long enough
text: great location and friendly accommodating staff let down by poor food at dinner on the one night we stayed there. Half the dinner menu was unavailable. I am sure that we were unlucky but it did spoil our evening. The hotel was also being refurbished so we did not necessarily see it in the bets possible light.
